SECRET.
G.T.6017
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 17th OCTOBER, 1918.
1.WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
On the Fourth Army front we have had very heavy fighting all day. The line runs as reported this morning. The enemy have been counter-attacking. So far 1,500 prisoners are reported captured.
South of the British attack the French are reported to have taken MENNEVRET and LE-PETIT-VERLY, THIOLET, GROUGIS (doubtful), they have not got BERNOVILLE.
On the 5th Army front the line runs :- OIGNIES, LIBERCOURT, CAMPHIN, SECLIN, TEMPLE MARS, WATTIGNES, HAUBOURDIN, LA METERIE.
The Second Army have taken WAMBRECHIES and the line runs north through LA VIGNE, RECKEM, LAUWE (all inclusive).
The Belgians' line runs west of MEULEBEKE, PITTHEM, east of BEGHEM, SWEVEZEELE, BERGEN, MOERE, thence doubtful between that place and OSTEND.
The Navy are reporte to have occupied OSTEND, and the few remaining GERMANS were captured by the civil population.
2. ITALIAN AND PALESTINE FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
3. BALKAN FRONT.
In Serbian Serbian troops have entered KRUSHEVATZ, (60 miles north-west of NISH), and BRUS, (west of NISH).
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
17th October, 1918.
Issued at 6.30 p.m.
